Summary: Stack-based navigation using NavigationPage. Push and pop pages with typed APIs (Navigation.PushAsync<T>(), Navigation.PopAsync()) and optionally pass strongly-typed props to child components.
Remarks: NavigationPage hosts a stack of pages and enables forward/back navigation. In MauiReactor you use the Navigation property exposed to components to push a new page whose root is a component: Navigation.PushAsync<TComponent>() creates a new page with TComponent as its root; Navigation.PopAsync() returns to the previous page. You can pass data to the next page via props using Navigation.PushAsync<TComponent, TProps>(configureProps) where configureProps initializes the props object before navigation. Note: because a page’s root component is not unmounted on final traversal for performance reasons, OnWillUnmount won’t be called for the root when the page disappears; use the page’s OnDisappearing callback or subscribe to the Page.Disappearing event to run cleanup when a page goes away.
